text:
Travel photography platform, Trover, has worked with compiled a list of the best places for stargazing around the world

If you’re a fan of stargazing but live in a busy city like London, you may find yourself frustrated with the lack of visibility in the night sky.

But if you’re willing to travel, there are some incredible areas around the world where the stars are beautifully bright.

Travel photography platform, Trover, has worked with astronomy expert Jamie Carter to compile a list of the best places for stargazing around the world.

The top sites include Chile’s Atacama Desert, New Zealand’s Aoraki/Mount Cook National Park, and the US’s Joshua Tree National Park, to name but a few.

These areas all have one key thing in common - a lack of light pollution. This makes it much easier to appreciate the stars, as well as the moon, planets and even galaxies.
